subject: Taking the DANCE On the Road
event: Yes, I will be doing a book tour for A DANCE WITH DRAGONS. It will, alas, be a shorter tour than the ones I did for A STORM OF SWORDS and A FEAST FOR CROWS. (Although we all expect that the crowds will be bigger). As much as I love meeting my readers and signing their books, I still have a lot on my plate just now, and I can't afford to take off a month for travel. So we'll likely be limiting the US book tour to no more than eight to ten cities. The first three of those have already been set. We'll be launching the tour in BOSTON, followed by appearances in NEW YORK CITY, and then INDIANAPOLIS. Herewith the details: Tuesday, July 12 7:00pm Barnes & Noble 98 Middlesex Turnpike Burlington, MA 01803 Thursday, July 14 7:00pm Barnes & Noble Union Square 33 East 17th Street New York, NY 10003 Saturday, July 16 2:00pm Barnes & Noble 14709 US Hwy 31 North Carmel, IN 46032 After Indy I will return home for a few days, and then it will be on to... ... yes, the SAN DIEGO COMICON. I'll be there for the entire comicon. The 2012 Ice & Fire calendar will be making its debut there, and of course we'll have DANCE WITH DRAGONS out, and some advance stuff for the comic book adaptation. I will also be appearing on the HBO panel for the TV show, turning up at the Tor booth to promote the new Wild Cards book, FORT FREAK... and likely also appearing for IDW (the DOORWAYS comic) and Avatar (the FEVRE DREAM graphic novel). Work, work, work. If my hand hasn't fallen off by the end of comicon, I will be resuming the book tour afterwards with a west coat swing. Details on that when they are nailed down. But if you're in Boston, NYC, Indy, or San Diego... hey, be seeing you soon.

comments.article: Good luck! And if you stop by Dallas, I'll be there!!
Me too!!!
Powells Books, Cedar Hills Store!!!!!!! :D
comments.subject: Portland-Portland-Portland

comments.article:
Listen to DDSyrdal. He or she knows what he or she is talking about.

Powell's would be awesome, especially the square block-spanning one downtown. Hell, anywhere in the PDX area would be peachy.

comments.upictitle: → the beggar king.: TV | GoT | Viserys | Stare
comments.article:
Oh dear lord, this is my first year going to SDCC, and it falls right on my birthday. Therefore, I can't even begin to express in words how excited I am that you're going to be there!

Out of curiosity, do you happen to know if HBO will have their big Iron Throne there?

comments.upictitle: почему Джеффри Раш не мой дядя?: Roose Bolton
comments.article: winter is coming!
One day! One day I'll get to come to your book signing. I hope you have a safe and super fun trip!

Well, if you don't do Philly, I'll consider roadtripping up to NYC; I haven't seen you and Parris in years, after all. God knows if I could even get close to you these days, though!

Still, fingers crossed you'll be coming back to Philly -- you know you always have good friends here. :)

Alas, Philly is not on the schedule.

You need to come to Reno, not NYC. Cons are the place to hang and catch up. Booksignings, not so much. There could be a thousand people in NYC, and I probably won't have the time to spend more than thirty seconds with any of them.

Come to worldcon instead! It would be swell to see you again too.

Dammit, seems everyone is coming to my favorite NYC Barnes and Noble now that I've left the city.

Oh well. As essential as the vibrant, bustling metropolis of Detroit is to any book tour, I have no doubt you'll be doing multiple appearances here, too...right? RIGHT!?
AUUUGHHH!!! Too bad you can't switch the Burlington & NY signings  ---  I'll be in Burlington Thurs. for Readercon!!!*tears hair*
I'm sure that you would enjoy signing books in Bilbao, Spain. You should ^^
Fantastic! I'll be at San Diego Comic Con as part of the Rifftrax crew...and after working it for 4 years in a row now I'm actually excited again. Thanks, sir. :)
Come to Nashville again! We loved having you. :)

Hooray!  Burlington is quite near me - I have never, EVER been to a book signing before.  This'll be a first.  Yay!  Can't wait to meet you!

Come to Boskone some year. Cons are much better places to meet writers than signings.

Oh, oh, oh!  Union Square signing is my birthday!  I *have* to get in to the city that day.:)
So happy that you'll be starting the signings in MA. I'm just now having to decide how long in advance I need to start staving my spot.
Sweet. I've already scheduled myself out of work early for the kickoff in MA. :) Hooray!
Awesome! I'll be at San Diego comicon again this year. I will, at the very least, be at the HBO panel for the show. I am now even more excited for July!
If you do hit the West Coast, please consider coming back to Vancouver! Lots of new fans up here! :)
comments.subject: Vancouver

comments.article: I second this.  Although I'll gladly drive down to Seattle if that's as close as you come.
comments.subject: Re: Vancouver

comments.article: Mr. Martin, will you be coming to Europe at all? Don't know exactly where, but I've read that you might be coming to Slovenia this summer... Any chance of it being true? :)
comments.subject: Europe?

comments.article:
Yes, I will be visiting Slovenia for three days at the end of June. June 22 - 24, to be precise. I'll be making appearances in three cities: Koper, Ljubljana, and Maribor.

Which reminds me, I really need to update my Appearances page.
comments.subject: Re: Europe?

comments.article: Since we're all so awesome in MN, I think you should try to make it out to the 2nd annual Days of Ice and Fire.  Should be a good time, and hopefully less blizzardy (yes I made that word up) this year.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: bat
comments.article: Woohoo! Looks like we'll be making it to Readercon on Friday this year... Looking forward to seeing you in NYC, even if it is for 2 seconds. I'll smuggle you a slice to keep your energy up. ;-)

Well, I see from your comments that there will be no Philly, so guess a few friends and I will need to take the trip to NYC.  Yeah, I only get to see you for like 10 seconds and probably wait in line for hours, but I'm sure it will be fun.  Plus any excuse for a day off work is fine with me.
comments.subject: Road Trip

comments.article: Woo-Hoo!!! See you there. :)
comments.subject: You're coming to Indy???

comments.article: Yay, I may make the Boston signing.... Best wishes with all the run-up to the release and all the associated hoopla :)

Do you know if you'll be making your usual stop at Page One here in ABQ, Mr. Martin?  It was great to listen to you speak at the signing for <u>Feast</u>, so I'm hoping you'll be coming by here again since you live so close.  *grin*  And hey, any signing where you don't get upstaged by Clifford the Big Red Dog is a good one.
